text: SUPER TITLES as we move across a black rocky landscape. Canyons and crevices, pitted and gnarled — alien. Panning up off the rocks — not an alien world, but the jagged volcanic rocks of Auckland’s North Shore - to reveal RANGITOTO ISLAND on the other side of the water. Dark and sinister.

The prow of a small boat bumps against jagged black rocks. Tight shots as two young men help one another out of the boat onto the rocks, hand clasping hand. Struggling to balance on jagged volcanic rock, they steady each other, at last finding their footing: JOHAN and LENART — IDENTICAL TWINS with COPPER HAIR, dressed in coarse 19th century clothing. Ahead of them, a man stands with his back to us, looking up at the dark cone of Rangitoto. He turns to them — this is MR JONES, grey, weathered, ageless.
When we get to the crater, use your twin- ness. Throw the stones as one.
I think we can.
You have to believe it. Mr Jones looks to Lenart, less certain than his brother.
But what if they come?

They’re dormant. We’1ll take them by surprise. The three of them head for the tree line.  UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 2. EXT. RANGITOTO BUSH — DAY Figures push through the thick island scrub — Johan and Lenart lead, followed by Mr Jones. Lenart strides ahead, pushing through the undergrowth.

Stay together! Noises rattle through the trees around them. The twins spin, pulling two round STONES from their pockets and brandishing them like weapons. A warm, fiery glow spills from between their fingers. Shapes dart in the trees, all around them. A chorus of horrible, otherworldly BARKS rings out. A DARK SHAPE seems to lash out of the shadows — Johan falls — his stone skitters across the ground —

Johan! Johan looks up at his brother, stricken — He reaches for his fallen stone — But is YANKED suddenly into the shadows with a SHRIEK! Lenart looks to Mr Jones desperately — LENART (CONT’D) Help us, Mr Jones! Mr Jones stumbles back, deciding what he must do — He looks down to see Johan’s stone lying at his feet.
The perfect volcanic cone, black against the sky.
Please!
UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 3.

Dense bush rolls over rugged hills. Black clouds boil in the sky. A straight road leads out of a small COUNTRY VILLAGE through fenced paddocks. A SCHOOLBAG tumbles over a fence. A teenage girl wearing a schoolbag, RACHEL, climbs the fence and looks back. She grins, holds out a hand.
Need help? A teen boy, THEO, appears and clambers up the fence.

No. As he gets to the top, his foot slips on the wire. Instinctively, he throws out a hand, Rachel meets it with her own, steadying him on the fence. The pair are about 14 and have the same COPPER HAIR and green eyes: they’re unmistakably TWINS. They both jump down. Rachel grabs Theo’s bag and runs off, Theo in pursuit. They run together up the road — matched for speed, Rachel just ahead.
At a wide gate they cross the road. Rachel swings the bag around, flinging it under a hedge. She starts down the long driveway as Theo runs for his bag.
(laughs) You are so gonna die for that! She rounds a curve in the drive and stops in her tracks —
A POLICE CAR is parked in the driveway of the weather- beaten house ahead. Rachel stares, her eyes wide.
Theo! Why is there a —  10 11 12 13 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 4.
Theo can also hear her. His own INNER VOICE joins hers, their words overlapping:
— a police car. Rachel, where’s mum’s car —
Theo’s voice rings in Rachel’s head. Their thoughts have become one, a fluid sharing of words and feelings:
— what if there's been —
— there’s been an accident —
Theo, alone on the road, shares her sudden alarm.
— an accident. I'm sure there's —
— there’s nothing to be scared of —
Rachel runs to the house.
— I’m scared, Theo!
Theo drops his bag and runs up the drive.

Rachel pulls open the screen door of the farmhouse and creeps down the long dark tunnel of the hall. Ahead, through the door, we find a POLICEMAN standing with his hat in his hands. Rachel pushes the door open further to reveal the twins’ FATHER, sitting at the table, face slack with shock. (CONTINUED)
13 14 15 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 5.

The Policeman looks up, his compassionate expression chilling. Bursting into the KITCHEN, Rachel runs to her father. She searches his face for an answer to the question she’s afraid to ask. He nods, tears streaming down his face. Rachel trembles with shock —
Theo stops in his tracks, trembling as Rachel is — FEELING WHAT SHE'S FEELING. Theo approaches the house with trepidation. He climbs the porch, pulls open the door.

Theo heads down the hallway, fearful ... IN THE KITCHEN, Rachel looks up — face wracked with grief. In the hall, Theo reels back against the wall, feeling her pain, frozen — IN THE KITCHEN, Rachel looks towards the door that separates them.
Theo? IN THE HALLWAY, Theo shakes his head, unable to bear it. We hear her voice in his mind again, desperate.
Theo? I need you. Something seems to snap. Theo scrambles back up the hall, slams through the screen door and stumbles out onto the lawn.

Theo, I — The screen door BANGS behind him — her voice cutting off in his mind, as though a door between them has SLAMMED SHUT. We push in towards the screen door, watching him ... then PULL FOCUS to the mesh, shutting out everything beyond.  16 17 18 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 6. EXT. COUNTRY CHURCHYARD — DAY 16 A dark hole in the ground: a GRAVE. Gathered around it are two dozen MOURNERS in dark clothing and an Anglican Reverend, REVEREND BLATTY.

I am the resurrection and the life, saith the Lord; he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live; and whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Standing on either side of the grave is Theo and Rachel, the hole in the ground a dark chasm between them. Theo looks to the head of the grave where their father kneels over the edge of the hole, sobbing. Rachel steps forward, scattering a handful of rose petals into the grave. Theo clutches a handful of petals, his expression impassive. Rachel searches Theo’s face, looking for some way in. Tears roll down her cheeks. He meets her eyes for a moment, then looks away. His petals are clenched in his fist, knuckles white. We CUT WIDE: a cluster of dark figures small in the landscape. The dark sky boils overhead. FADE OUT.
FADE IN on the sprawling city of Auckland passing by, as seen from train level.
The train clatters and rattles. Theo peers out at the passing suburbs.
Next stop, Central Auckland. Central Auckland, next stop.
Let me see — Theo shrugs her away and returns to the window. (CONTINUED )
18 19 20 21 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 7.
Get off! Theo looks outside again, frowns — Outside, pushing up out of the houses and roads is a GREEN VOLCANIC CONE. Up ahead, another cone.
A train pulls into the station. Rachel and Theo walk past, Rachel struggling with her bag, Theo pushing on ahead.
Volcanic steam clouds the air — a fountain outside the station. Through the haze, we see Theo step out of the station, looking around. Rachel appears behind him, dragging her bag.

Where is he? INT/EXT. RICKY’S CAR/AUCKLAND PARK - DAY 21 The interior of a cramped, ratty-looking DATSUN. Two teenagers are making out clumsily. Things are almost heating up ... Knees bang against the handbrake — an elbow smacks the door —
Ow!

Sorry. A CELL PHONE RINGS. RICKY bolts upright, bangs his head, grimaces. Ricky is 18, almost cool, but not quite old enough to pull it off. CLEMENTINE, the same age, is the kind of girl guys like Ricky get only in their dreams. We see now that the car is parked under trees — a secluded park. (CONTINUED)
21 22 23 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 8.
Ricky fumbles for the phone ... it falls under the seat +. he rattles around, hunting for it, crushing Clementine.
Ow — leave it — Ricky! Ricky retrieves the phone, checks it.
Oh man! What’s the time? Clementine sighs and switches off the music.
The Datsun pulls up at the dropping zone, Ricky alone at the wheel. The twins sit on their luggage at the kerb. Ricky leans across the passenger seat and opens the door.
Sorry I'ma bit late. Theo eyes the crappy car dubiously.
We’re not gonna get far in this thing.
Catch the bus if you want, I don’t care. The twins pile into the car.

Nice hickey. Alarmed, Ricky checks the rear-view mirror to find a small hickey on his neck. EXT/INT. CENTRAL AUCKLAND STREETS/RICKY’S CAR - DAY 23 The car rattles and roars in complaint as Ricky hammers down inner city streets. Rachel sits in the front; in the back, Theo looks out the window at the city. Rachel looks back, notes the BLACK CLOUD coughing out of the car’s exhaust. (CONTINUED)
23 24 25 26 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 9.
I bet you can see your carbon footprint from space.
That’s good, right? Rachel rolls her eyes.
So your Dad ... he’s okay, right?
He just needed some ‘time out’.
He’s having a total meltdown.
That’s great. That’s a really great thing to tell people.
It’s true.

We crane up as Ricky’s car crosses the harbour bridge. The spectacular collision of cosmopolitan city and Auckland's volcanic field is revealed: green cones rise beyond city buildings. Looming over everything, the dark triangle of Rangitoto Island stands guardian to the harbour.

Facing Rangitoto is the clutter of Takapuna’s apartment buildings and malls. Beside it we find LAKE PUPUKE, a large body of water in the middle of a verdant suburb. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 26 Ricky’s car pulls up at a modernist mansion that steps down toward the lake. Rachel and Theo gape at the conspicuous opulence of the house. (CONTINUED)
26 27 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 10.
AUNT KAY and UNCLE CLIFF bustle out of the house as the kids climb out of the car. Aunt Kay buries them in hugs.
Hello, you two!
Hi Auntie Kay. As Ricky retrieves the bags from the car, Uncle Cliff shakes hands with Theo.
(playfully serious) Theo.
Cliff.
Cool place.
(heading inside) Yeah — if you wanna live in a concrete bunker.
Nobody’s forcing you!
Whatever. Ricky makes a face behind Cliff's back. The twins laugh. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - DAY 27 Kay leads Rachel into a spacious guest room with bunk beds. The curtains are drawn.
(dubious ) Bunks. Kay pauses ... looks at Rachel, misty-eyed. Rachel looks away, awkward.
You look so much like her.
I know. (CONTINUED)
27 28 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 11.
Rachel senses what’s needed: she offers a hug. Her Aunt holds her tightly, her eyes closed, comforted. Rachel's eyes remain open, her expression distant.

I'll let you get unpacked. Kay bustles out. Rachel pulls back the curtains to reveal — A spectacular view of the lake. Houses, walkways and parks encircle its shore. Under gathering clouds, the water seems black. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S DECK - DAY 28 Theo looks out at the lake at the end of the garden. Houses ring the shimmering water. It’s darkly beautiful.
You see the volcanoes on the way in? Theo turns to see Cliff standing behind him. He nods.
Are they dangerous?
Only when they erupt. But there hasn’t been an eruption round here for a few hundred years.
I wanna go check them out.
You don’t have to go far — (points to the lake) You're right on the edge of one.
The lake?

It’s a crater. Theo looks back to the lake, eyes widening.  29 30 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 12. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S BACK GARDEN - DAY 29 Theo walks down the lawn to the lake’s edge. He stops and sniffs, recoiling at a smell. He looks out across the lake, scanning the houses around the shore. His eyes fall on one. He steps forward to see better. Across an inlet is a two-story wooden house, its weatherboards flaky and peeling. More than 100 years old, the craggy verandahs and dark windows make the house feel like a dark sentinel watching the lake.
What’s that smell? Rachel is behind him. Theo doesn’t look up.
I dunno.
Like rotten cabbages. Is it the water? Theo looks back across the lake to the house ...

I can’t smell anything. He turns and walks up the lawn. Rachel watches him go, frustrated. She steps out to the edge of the water and looks out at the old house. Spooky place. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DUSK 30 An open package of fish and chips hits the floor. Uncle Cliff grabs a handful of chips and collapses onto the couch in between Theo and Ricky, who protest noisily.
(cuffles Theo's hair) Just getting closer to the fire. Theo rolls his eyes.
And there are kayaks — Richard, you'll show them the kayaks? (CONTINUED)
30 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 13.
Ricky is sending a text message, frantically thumbing the numbers on his phone.
They’re under the house, round the back.
Show them.
When do we get to meet this girl? What’s her name — Tangerine?
(glares) Clementine. Theo looks around for something ... turns to see Rachel holding out the sauce bottle with a half-smile. He snatches it and pours sauce onto his plate.
What’s up with that old house?
The Wilberforce place?
They're freaks, eh.
They just keep to themselves.
I've seen him sitting out there by the lake at, like, two o’clock in the morning and stuff.
Old people have trouble sleeping.
You’d know.
You might be old one day, if you're really lucky.
It used to be a funeral home.
Richard ... (CONTINUED)
30 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 14.
(laughing) Who told you that?
For real! Crazy old guy still drives the hearse.
Honestly ...
His car does look like a hearse ...
I bet the house is full of corpses. He probably does autopsies and taxidermy and stuff ... Rachel goes pale at talk of funeral parlours and bodies.
Shut up, Theo.
He might embalm you if he catches you —

Shut up! A LOW RUMBLE. The house SHAKES around them — an EARTHQUAKE! Theo looks around, wide-eyed, as the furniture and knick-knacks shift and rattle. Quickly, the tremor subsides. They exchange glances, scared — thrilled — then everyone talks as once:
God, another one ...
Don’t everybody get under the table at once.
That’s gotta be a 3.5, a four even!
That was awesome! Kay looks at Cliff, worried.
It‘'ll be fine. (CONTINUED)
30 31 32 33 34 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 15.

Amid the chatter and bustle, Rachel is quietly terrified. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 31 Rachel emerges from the bathroom in her pyjamas, heads down the hall. MURMURS come from inside Ricky’s room. Rachel pauses in the doorway, eavesdropping. THROUGH THE GAP we can see Ricky lying on his bed, talking quietly on his phone.

I can’t. (beat) I’m supposed to drive my cousins around. (beat) I know ... I do want to, I promise. Rachel steps away from the door and heads towards the guest bedroom. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 32 Theo lies awake in the top bunk. Rachel enters in her pyjamas, closes the door behind her.
(whispers) Theo? Theo pretends to be asleep. Rachel pads to the window.
The sinister shape of the Wilberforce house across the lake. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 34 Rachel peers through the murk at the eerie house. From his bed, Theo watches Rachel.
35 36 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 16.

The tall figure of a MAN stands in the shadows under the rusting verandah. He seems to be looking back at Rachel. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 34B Rachel stares back, a little spooked. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE/KITCHEN - MORNING 35 A note on the bench reads GONE TO WORK - EAT REAL FOOD! A large kitchen with expensive fittings. A small TV, switched on, the sound muted. On the bench is a selection of cereal boxes. Theo scans them, trying to decide. MOMENTS LATER: Theo serves himself a bowl of ice cream and starts eating. On TV, a smiling TV NEWS READER talks against a backdrop image of CENTRAL AUCKLAND and the heading Auckland Shaken. Theo grabs the REMOTE and switches on the sound —

Aucklanders ducked for cover last night as the latest in a series of small earthquakes rattled the region. The shallow jolt measured 3.7 on the Richter Scale and was centred on Rangitoto Island. The Seismic Research Institute said today that the quake is unlikely to be an indication of volcanic activity, and Aucklanders have no cause for alarm. (beat) The meat industry is breathing a sigh of relief today after lamb exports were given the all clear following an unexplained incident at a lower North Island sheep station ...
INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY 36 An ARTIST'S RENDERING of RANGITOTO in full eruption, dark clouds a FIERY RED. The heading reads RANGITOTO - “BLEEDING SKIES”. (CONTINUED)
36 37 38 39 40 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 17.

(to himself) Bleeding skies. Theo sits in a soft couch with his back to the lake. He’s reading a hardback book — VOLCANOES OF AUCKLAND, circa the 1980s. He flips through the pages. A MAP OF AUCKLAND shows the VOLCANOES marked in red. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 37 Rachel, in a bright life jacket, drags a kayak down the grass to the water’s edge. She climbs in and pushes off.

Rachel cuts across the black water, paddling carefully but confidently. She peers down into the darkness, spooked — it’s deep down there. Rachel looks up to find she’s nearing the Wilberforce house. Dead trees frame the house, skeletal fingers reaching out across the water. Seen from the lake through leafless branches and tangled vines, the Wilberforce house is dark and tumbledown, weatherboards thick with moss, roof rotten and sunken-in, windows dark. No signs of life. CREEAAK! The back door opens, just a crack. Something moves in the darkness beyond. Rachel's eyes widen ... then she squeals as a branch snags her hair. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY 39 Theo jerks, reaches to his head. He looks out to where Rachel and the kayak bob in the shadow of the dead trees.
Rachel reaches up to find that her hair tie is gone. (CONTINUED)
40 41 42 43 44 45 46 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 18.
With a last glance at the old house, she turns and paddles for shore.

Rachel drags the kayak out of the water into the reeds at the lake's edge. She looks back at the Wilberforce house. A figure picks its way down from his house towards the lakeshore. Rachel ducks behind the reeds, watching.

Under the shadow of the house, the man moves as if slowed and bent by age, but his frame is monumental. His lined face seems roughly hewn from stone, eyes black holes under heavy brows. MR WILBERFORCE reaches into the dead tree. He takes something from its branches, opens his hand to reveal — Rachel's hair tie. Mr Wilberforce slowly raises his hand to his face ... and seems to SNIFF at the hair.
Rachel watches, horrified ...
Mr Wilberforce closes a club-like fist around her hair tie and crunches back up the path to his house.

Rachel shrinks, chilled. She looks around the lawn, suddenly feeling vulnerable. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY 46 In the living room, Theo turns to the next page. More images — another volcano — a grassy cone with a view out over the city ...  47 48 49 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 19. EXT/INT. MT EDEN ROAD/RICKY’S CAR - DAY 47 Ricky’s car drives through the centre of Mt Eden, towards the grassy cone of the volcano towering above. A sign reads MT EDEN SUMMIT. Ricky’s car follows the road up towards Mt Eden. Ricky drives, the twins crammed into the car with him. Craggy trees line the road like a tunnel of gnarled talons, sunlight filtering through in eerie shafts. Rachel’s eyes widen — A DARK FIGURE can be glimpsed between the trunks, still as a statue, as if watching the car. Rachel looks back — the figure is gone, hidden by the trees.
A huge grassed bowl — the crater of this not-long-dead volcano. Rachel, Theo and Ricky stand on the platform, dwarfed by the scale of it. Beyond, over city and water, is Rangitoto.
(pointing) That’s One Tree Hill ... Mt Krakatoa over there ... Mt Vesuvius ... Mt Etna. That’s
North Head and Rangitoto. Rachel shivers against the cold.
I thought Auckland was supposed to be warm.
I’m gonna find some volcanic rock. Theo jumps down off the stone wall and heads around the crater.
Theo marches around the edge, putting all his being into walking hard, making himself feel nothing else. A cold wind whips at him, the sky is grey. (CONTINUED)
49 50 51 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 20.
He stops and looks down into the deep hole, the people at the bottom tiny.
Rachel looks out across the city. Ricky leans on the fence, texting. Beyond, Theo strides around the crater rim. Ricky looks up from his phone, watches Theo.
Is he okay?

I can’t get through to him. It’s like he’s on another planet. EXT. MT EDEN CRATER RIM — DAY 51 Theo looks up to the crest of the hill above him. A figure sits, silhouetted on the edge, facing Rangitoto. Mr Jones is barely older than when we last saw him, but he seems a shadow of his former self: beaten, the fire has died in his eyes. He stares across at the black island opposite. A warm glow of FIRELIGHT dances on his face, emanating from his hands. Theo approaches the old man from behind. A flicker of FLAME in his hands. Theo peers closer, intrigued. As Theo steps up Jones closes his hands, the fire disappears. He stuffs whatever made the fire into the pockets of his jacket. He turns to Theo, his eyes blazing with momentary interest. He looks up at Theo’s copper hair. Theo raises a hand to his hair involuntarily. The man seems to stare into him, read him, as if looking for an answer from him ... Theo turns and hurries on around the crater. As he goes the light in the old man’s eyes dies — as if he was searching for something and realised, with disappointment, it wasn’t to be found with Theo. (CONTINUED)
51 52 53 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 21.
He looks back across the city and sea to the distant volcano. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S KITCHEN - EVENING 52 Ricky is getting a grilling from Kay and Cliff.
Cause I’ve got things to do.
What things?
Better things.
Okay, but you’re taking the twins with you.
I don’t get why I have to babysit them. They're not kids —
We're not saying they are.

Why’d you put them in bunks then? INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - EVENING 53 Theo reads, the volcano book open on his lap. Rachel talks on the phone, trying to shield the mouthpiece from the argument in the kitchen.
(into the phone) Nothing got broken but the whole house was shaking ...
You have to start taking some responsibility, Richard ...
A “commitment” is where you actually have to do whatever it is you said you'd do. (CONTINUED)
53 54 55 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 22.
(into the phone) Anyway, we'll tell you about it when we get home. Sorry you’re not there ...
What are you, my English teacher?
(into the phone) -.-. hope you’re okay. I love you. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S KITCHEN - EVENING 54 Cliff leans in towards Ricky, so as not to be overheard.
You think this is hard on you? Try and imagine what Rachel and Theo are going through. Ricky looks away, guilty.
You promised to do your part.
Like I need reminding. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - EVENING 55 Ricky stomps past as Rachel holds the phone out to Theo.
(without looking up) I‘m reading.

It’s just voicemail. She’s still holding out the phone. He sighs, takes it, then waits ... At last, she gets his drift and leaves the room. As soon as she’s gone, Theo switches off the phone and puts it aside. He picks up the book. In a sepia-toned photograph, a group of settlers picnics on the shore of Lake Pupuke. A man stands apart, looking towards the camera: MR JONES. (CONTINUED)
55 56 57 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 23.

Theo frowns. There’s something familiar about the old man in the photo ... EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 56 The house glows pale, like boxes of reflected moonlight on the dark shore. Rachel looks out the window in the direction of the Wilberforce house — then pulls the curtains across. In the darkness, a sickly SNIFFING sound, like some guttural animal following a scent. SHAPES melt out of the darkness — one, three, five, more: dark sentinels push forward from the shadows. In the darkness, we can make out several MEN IN DARK SUITS. They stare up at the house, watching, waiting ... EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 57 Ricky comes out of the house, followed by Theo and Rachel. They join Uncle Cliff who glares down at the lawn, his expression dark.
(to Ricky) You lot know anything about this? Dead patches of grass blot the lawn. Trails of brown lead back to the edge of the lake.
Nope.
Well, I haven’t been out here.
Why is everything my fault? It’s outside their room, anyway. The trail of footprints does indeed lead towards Rachel and Theo’s window. Rachel and Theo follow the trail to below their window.
(quietly to Theo) Someone's spying on us! (CONTINUED)
57 58 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 24.
Theo’s eyes alight with excitement.
Yeah! She meets his gaze, spooked ... then turns to look back across at the Wilberforce house.

Rangitoto — as seen from the surface of the sea: a black pyramid, filling the horizon. Uncle Cliff stands on the deck of a bobbing boat — THE SEA LADY — expertly playing and casting a large fishing rod. Ricky sits behind, wearing a lifejacket and holding his phone in the air, trying to get a signal. A snorkel surfaces from the black water in a puff of spray ... Theo follows it, coming up for air. He turns towards the mountain, treading water. Theo jerks under — — then comes up spluttering. Rachel surfaces behind him and laughs.
Dick. Theo swims back towards the boat. Rachel looks up at the looming black peak and frowns, as though remembering something once said to her ...

Bleeding skies. She GASPS suddenly, catching a glimpse of — A FIGURE, lurking in the trees above the rocks at the water’s edge. A Wilberforce DRONE. Chilled, Rachel swims strongly to the boat and hauls herself on board. She looks back towards the island — there’s no sign of the Drone now — Suddenly, Cliff’s fishing rod SCREAMS as the reel unwinds. He grabs the handle, reels furiously. The rod bends alarmingly. He shouts — — and heaves a flapping fish over the side of the boat. The others jump back as he lowers it to the deck. (CONTINUED)
58 59 60 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 25.
Well, don't just stand there.

The glassy-eyed fish hits a sheet of newspaper laid out on the asphalt. A concrete boat ramp leads down to a sandy North Shore beach. Ricky and Uncle Cliff hook the boat trailer onto the car. Theo wrinkles his nose and looks around ... frowns as something further around the road catches his eye.
Theo holds his hand over his nose and mouth as he approaches the Wilberforces’ hearse, parked under trees. Rachel scampers to catch up with him.
It’s a hearse. Must be them — the Wilberforces. She stops, her hand going to her nose. Theo gags.
It stinks!

The same as at the lake. The twins reach the hearse. The back doors are closed. Something viscous drips from them onto the ground. Theo cups his hand against the back window to peer in. His breath fogs the glass. Something coats the inside, obscuring the view. He reaches for the door handle.

Maybe we shouldn't ... Theo pulls the doors open. It opens with a SCHLUK, like a wound being pulled open. Stringy slime clings to the edges. The twins grimace in disgust as they see — The hearse interior is warped and gnarled, crusted with glistening layers of organic matter. (CONTINUED)
60 61 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 26.
Rachel gags, her hand going to her mouth.
What is it? Theo reaches out to touch the fleshy interior, then jerks his hand back.
What, is it hot?
It's cold!

I wonder what they’re doing here. Rachel turns, looks out to sea: Rangitoto lurks on the horizon beyond the dark water. RACHEL (CONT’D) Theo, are they watching us? Theo stares into the depths of the car, eyes bright with interest. INT. RICKY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 61 Theo bursts into Ricky’s dark bedroom, binoculars and a torch in his hand.
Theo! Theo goes to the window.

Keep the light off, that’s good. He peers through the binoculars. There is a thump and rustle from behind him. Theo lowers the binoculars and turns around. Ricky glowers at Theo as Clementine, sitting on the edge of the bed, pulls her T-shirt on over her bra. Theo stares, open mouthed. Clementine glares back at him.
Enjoying the view? (CONTINUED)
UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 27.
Clem, wait ... She pushes past Theo and goes to the window. She pushes it open and turns back.
Call me when the school holidays are over. She throws a leg over the sill and jumps out the window. Theo watches her go ... and then looks back to Ricky.
Whoa!
Thanks a lot, Theo.
Is she your girlfriend? Have you ... Ricky collapses on his bed, pulls his pillow over his head and MOANS!
No! Theo watches him for a minute ... Ricky plays dead. Theo goes back to the window, training the binoculars on the Wilberforce house.
You think they’re home?
(muffled under covers) It's just a creepy old house.
Then let’s go check it out.
